content.description: Joey and now Rachel’s apartment, Joey has the fridge pulled out away from the wall and is in the process of pulling off the cooling grate behind it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well that thing is clearing in the way! All right. Ah-ha! (He grabs a screwdriver and starts to attack the compressor, only he causes a small short circuit and shocks himself.) Ah-ah!! Damn fridge!
(Rachel enters from her new room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Joey, how ya doin’?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Roomie!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh, yeah I guess we are roommates now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Well, now that you brought it up, our fridge is broken. We have to get a new one. Now, I checked around and your half is $400. Thanks a lot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not paying for half of that! I’m only staying here until my apartment gets fixed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look Rach, my parents bought this fridge just after I was born, okay? Now, I have never had a problem with it. Then you show up and it breaks! What does that tell ya’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That refrigerators don’t live as long as people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, now you know that the ATM will only lets you take out 300 at a time, I’ll take a check for the other hundred.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re jokin’ right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course I’m jokin’! I don’t take checks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank God you’re pretty. (Exits.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi! Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you guys know any cute guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, of course I do! My good friend Joey over here. (Pats Joey’s arm, Joey pats Chandler’s shoulder, and Chandler motions for Joey to say the same about him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Thank you Chandler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, there’s this big charity ball this weekend and Ralph Lauren bought a table, so I kinda have to go…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the charity?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, something either trees or disease—Ralph mumbles a lot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does Ralph mumble when you’re not paying attention?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! It’s weird. But the thing is need to find a date.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what kind of guy are you looking for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, someone that has his own tux, or has the ability to rent a tux.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So he has to be a male who has at least $50.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh! So close.
(Ross and Elizabeth enter.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey everybody!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey uh, this is Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I’m the student.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Isn’t she cute? (On Monica’s death stare) No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, this is probably none of my business, but weren’t you guys supposed to not be seen in public together?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh, we’re not together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no-no-no, we’re just two people who happen to run into each other here at the coffee house. (He winks at her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, sly.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Well, I really wanted to meet you guys, but I have to run. I’ll see you later?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Bye Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oops! I did not mean to run into you like that sir.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh that is quite all right ma’am. (Elizabeth exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, why is she leaving? Is it a school night and she has a lot of homework to do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, her molecular epidemiology paper is due tomorrow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, tell her good luck with that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyone else? Huh? Bring ‘em on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oo! When’s her birthday?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know Rachel, why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know it’s just been so long since I’ve been to Chuckie Cheese .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I like Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. In fact, I like her so much you tell her I want my cookies early this year! Y’know, a box of Thin Mints and some Tag-a-Longs .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey come on you guys, give him a break. Ross, seriously, how’s it going with her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, actually it’s been great. She’s 20 so she’s not looking for anything too serious, which is perfect for me right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that is great. And seriously, she seems very nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. I know you guys like to give me a hard time and all, but it really means a lot to me that you like her. Just knowing that you guys are…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I got a good one. Okay, umm, what is she? Like 12?

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is sitting at the table and Monica is doing something in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, do you think we talk about our relationship enough?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Do we have any Fruit Roll-Ups ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I just thought of the perfect guy for Rachel to take to her thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s so funny because we found someone too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s good, I guess she’ll have a choice between my guy and your weirdo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why would our guy be a weirdo?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Cause that’s just your taste.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel is not going to pick your stupid guy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My guy is a lawyer who has volunteer work. And, he has one of these (She squeezes the skin on her chin together to form…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A face ass?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A chin dimple!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, uh y’know, our guy works with Chandler and he’s really nice and smart and he’s a great dresser!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Have you seen your guy’s body?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, our guy is just a floating head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well my guy is spectacular. Okay? He’s a massage client and one time umm, when he was on the table, I looked at it. And I mean all of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not supposed to look!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, like there are police for that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait! You look? You-you massaged me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right fine, your guy may have a great body, but our guy is really funny.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Chandler funny?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Our guy’s a great dancer!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My guy is well read.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our guy has great hair.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My guy has great teeth!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our guy smells incredible.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want our guy to be your guy?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Chandler is entering to find Joey bingeing on the food from the fridge. Joey isn’t doing all that well.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you…don’t look good Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The fridge broke. I have to eat everything. Cold cuts, ice cream, limes—Hey, what was in that brown jar?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s still in there?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not anymore. So anyway, how do you want to pay me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is this a service you’re providing me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No! For my new fridge—our new fridge!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our new fridge? I don’t live here anymore.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what? Look, suppose we were a divorced couple.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I got custody of the kid, right? Now suppose the kid dies and-and I gotta buy a new kid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay…
content.parenthetical: not quite sure where Joey’s going and is a little worried

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Give me $400!

content.description: Ross’s office, he’s unlocking his office door as Elizabeth walks up.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Professor Geller?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm? (Turns around and sees that its Elizabeth) Oh, a student I don’t know.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I was wondering if I could talk to you for a moment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes of course, what-what would this be regarding?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Making out in your office.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shh! (Laughs then composes himself) Of course, why don’t we go inside?
(They go inside and Ross closes the door. When he turns around Elizabeth walks up to him, pushes him back against the door, and starts kissing him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-ooh!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Doorknob! Doorknob!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh! Sorry! Umm, I actually do need to talk to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, okay. What-what about?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Spring vacation.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Spring vacation.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah, we have time off and a lot of people are going on trips…
(Another professor barges in.)

content.speaker: Professor Feesen
content.text: Professor Geller!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, professor Feesen-sen-stenlger… I’ll be with you in one moment. (To Elizabeth) So, I will take one box of the Thin Mints . (And he ushers Elizabeth out of the office.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Ross, Chandler, and Joey are entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t understand! Elizabeth was about to ask me to go on a trip with her! Is that taking it slow?! No, I’m not ready for this! Okay? What-what do I tell her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just tell her the truth! Tell her you’re not ready.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can do that. Oh-oh, what if she gets upset?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then you distract her with a Barbie doll.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or! You can just, y’know… (He walks up close to whisper in Ross’s ear and when he gets there he pushes Ross into the fridge.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the hell are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? What the hell am I doing? You just broke my fridge!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What? How do you, how do you even know its broken?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho-ho, you think I don’t know what breaks my fridge? Excuse me! (He opens the door and feels inside.) Well what do you know! Broken! That’ll be $400!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, I saw you push him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You pushed him!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, I did not break this! Okay? (He opens the freezer and smells inside and recoils in disgust.) That has been broken for a while.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Chandler, do you remember how I told you about our fridge?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I still haven’t gotten a check for your half yet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do not give him any money!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not talking to you! You broke my fridge!

content.description: Ross’s office, he’s opening the door to Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: You wanted to see me Professor Geller?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes! Please, come in.
(She does so, he closes the door, and she pushes him against the doorknob again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oo-oo!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Doorknob?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it kinda grows on you. (They both laugh.) Actually, I wanted to finish talking to you about uh, spring vacation.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I… (He has trouble sitting in his chair.) Look, I’m having a great time with you and I just don’t want us to move to fast or put to much pressure on us. So, I’m sorry I just don’t think we should go away together yet. It’s-it’s too soon.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross, I think you misunderstood what I was saying. I just wanted to tell you that I’m going to Florida for a couple weeks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. I think you misunderstood what I was saying. What I meant was…

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: You are so adorable.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That! Let’s talk about that.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How did it go with Elizabeth?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? Oh-oh, it was fine. Uh, it was just a misunderstanding. She didn’t want me to go with her. She just wanted to let me know that she’s going to Florida for spring vacation.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, is she going for spring vacation or is she going for spring break? (Does a little whooping/party noise.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s-what’s the difference?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, spring vacation is doing nice things with your grandparents. Spring break you’re doing frat guys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know what? Not all spring breaks are like that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What did you do on yours?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I went to Egypt with my dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can see it now, “Look dad, it’s the Sphinx!” (Does that party noise again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I think Elizabeth is a little more serious than, “Spring break!” (Imitates the party noise.) All right? I mean she’s taken my class!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And slept with the professor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna call her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.
(Ross leaves to do so and Rachel enters with a guy.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! You guys umm, I want you to meet Sebastian.

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We just uh, we just met at the newsstand. We both grabbed for the last Field & Stream . (Chandler’s shocked.) What? I read that.

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Can I get you a cup of coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yes! Thank you! (He does so and Rachel sits down on the couch.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, what the hell is this?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You ask us to find you a guy and you come traipsing in here with your own!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You found me a guy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! We found you a really cute and funny guy from Chandler’s work!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah and I-I found you one too who is not a weirdo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what though you guys? I really appreciate that but I think I’m just gonna take Sebastian to the charity.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure?! Because our guy smells incredible!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, would you stop it with that already?!
(Sebastian returns with the coffee.)

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Here you go. (Hands her, her cup.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank you.

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, Sebastian, do you do any volunteer work?

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Uh, no not really. Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No reason, it’s just I know a single guy that cares about other people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you funny?

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you funny? Tell us a joke!

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Look, I just wanted to have coffee with Rachel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, so do a lot of people.

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Actually, I uh, I gotta get going. (To Rachel) Give me a call sometime.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, but y’know, no, you didn’t give me your phone number.

content.speaker: Sebastian
content.text: Okay! See you later! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Turns out he is kinda funny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe you guys! He was really nice and he left because of you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, but Sebastian? What is that? A cat’s name?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, y’know what I noticed Rachel? He scares easy. Is that the kind of guy you’d like to take to a ball? “Hey Sebastian, would you like to dance?” (Imitates him.) “Uhh, okay—I gotta go!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right guys stop it. Rachel, we’re very sorry that is a very insensitive thing for us to do. And y’know what? Let us make it up to you, we have two really great guys for you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! What have you got to lose? Y’know you might even end up with someone really special (whispers) if you pick my guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so you will meet our guys?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I’ll meet ‘em.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay now it doesn’t matter which one you choose, y’know? It’s completely up to you. Our guy is perfect, or you can go out with the guy Phoebe deemed not good enough to go out with herself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! There you are! Okay, you broke my fridge; you owe me 400 bucks!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay sure!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, technically you owe me $600 for sending out happy thoughts on your last ten auditions.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Call it even?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(Ross returns.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, there you are! So what did Elizabeth say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, it turns out that she is going to Daytona for spring break woo-hoo. That means, that means wet T-shirt contests, guys doing shots off of girl’s bodies, waking up next to people you don’t even know…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, she is going to have a great time! Is she staying at the Hotel Corona?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know the hotels?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! I was there! Spring Break ’81! Woo-hoo!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In 1981 you were 13!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what? I drove down, sold T-shirts, had a blast. And y’know who knows how to party? Drunk college chicks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, she can’t go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, you can’t tell her not to go. You just started dating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then what am I supposed to do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing, you just have to be cool with it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, what is she goes down and-and sleeps with a bunch of guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe you don’t marry this one.

content.description: Elizabeth’s apartment, she is packing for her trip as Ross watches.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m so glad you’re going on this trip!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah! I’ve been working so hard this semester. I really need to go crazy y’know, blow off some steam.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. Sure. Look I don’t, I don’t know if your plans are finalized yet, but umm, hey I-I know another great way to blow off steam.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you into crafts at all?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross, are you okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, yeah, of-of course I’m okay! What? I’m just being supportive. Supportive of you and this whole trip, and-and (notices something) what-what is uh, what’s this? (He holds up a rather skimpy bathing suit.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: It’s a bathing suit?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: To wear in front of people?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Is that supportive?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is this?!

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is reading as Monica and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good-good-good-good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re really glad you decided to meet our guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re gonna like him so much. So umm, when do you want to meet him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. I know I don’t work late tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tomorrow night is good. Tomorrow night is good, but uh, y’know what? Why put off something till tomorrow that you can do right now? (Laughs) Eldad come here! (He stands up from the next table.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Eldad, this is Rachel.

content.speaker: Eldad
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well-well a little blind sided but y’know good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eldad, sit down. (To Rachel) Move over! Move over now!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I—Ohh! (Moves over and lets Eldad sit on the couch.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There you go! There you are! (Rachel stares at Monica and Chandler)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Okay! We can take a hint! (They start to leave but run into Phoebe with her guy in tow.) (To Phoebe) What are you doing here?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is Patrick. (Points to him.)

content.speaker: Patrick
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi. (To Phoebe) Okay, you’re too late okay? Because she’s already with our guy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, you’re right! I am too late; they’re sitting on the couch and talking! (To Patrick) Come on! (They go over to the couch.) Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is Patrick.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Patrick
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, this is the guy I was telling you about.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. And believe me, this suit does not do justice to what’s underneath it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-okay, but Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just sort of in the middle of something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Okay! Yeah, that’s okay. (To Patrick) Have a seat. (Sits Patrick down next to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! You can’t do that!

content.speaker: Eldad
content.text: Maybe I should go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sit down! We’re winning!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? Maybe I should go!

content.speaker: All
content.text: No-no-no-no! Have a seat! Have a seat!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! Rachel! You haven’t touched Eldad’s hair!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is the softest hair! Touch it! (Both he and Monica do so.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel? Patrick is really rich. (To Patrick) Give her some money.

content.speaker: Patrick
content.text: Y’know what Phoebe? This isn’t really worth the free massage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right Patrick, bye-bye!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eldad is much more cooperative! And he can dance! (To Eldad) You dance for Rachel!
(He starts to get up, but Rachel stops him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no! Don’t dance for me! Please? Don’t! (She gets up to yell at her ‘friends.’) What is the matter with you guys?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay, let’s talk it out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I… Am I the only one that this is embarrassing for?

content.speaker: Eldad
content.text: I’m a little embarrassed. (Chandler shushes him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll tell ya who should be embarrassed! It’s you guys! Come on! This is ridiculous! Thank you very much, but I do not need you to get me a date!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then why did she ask us to…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am still talking!! And then you chase away the one guy that I actually liked! I mean, no offense to you guys. Really! I mean (To Patrick) congratulations on all the cash, (He nods) and-and y’know—(Feels Eldad’s hair)—Wow! You do have very soft hair! But I would much rather go to the ball all by myself than go through anymore of this! Good-bye! (Grabs her stuff, starts to leave, then turns back suddenly, and to Eldad) Now do you use some sort of special conditioner on that hair?!

content.speaker: Eldad
content.text: Yes, Papaya Extract.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you! (Storms out.)

content.description: The airport, Elizabeth’s flight is about to leave and Ross is there to send her off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, have a great time down there.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I will.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. And did you, did you pack that bathing suit?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was pretty funny when I, when I hid it for a while, huh? Anyway, umm, I-I am worried about that bathing suit, not because it’s revealing which I’m fine with, no I’m concerned about your health, sun exposure.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh, don’t worry I have plenty of sun block, it’s SPF-30.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, if what’s in the bottle is actually 30. I mean sometimes you get 30, sometimes it’s-it’s get 4, and I swear to God more often than not it’s just milk.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross, it’s going to be okay. I’m not going down there to hook up with a bunch of guys. I really like you. I like how things are going between us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah! I’m just going down there to relax and hang out with my friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Cool.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh hey! Here they are!
(A group of about 10 guys and no women come running around the corner.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Elizabeth!
(The guys pick up Elizabeth and carry her onto the plane as she waves bye.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Call me!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Rachel, Chandler, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, we’re sorry for pushing those guys on you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s all right! Y’know, I ended up having a really good time. Y’know, the charity was a big success and they raised a lot of money and awareness.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what was it for anyway?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I wanna say a disease.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just got this really weird message from Ross. He said turn on MTV .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. All right.
(Rachel does so and it’s one of those dance party shows they have during spring break and we see…)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, look! That’s Elizabeth!
(Suddenly Ross jumps in and starts dancing with her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh Professor Geller.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, to be 13 again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.
